page.title: 08TOURIST ATTITUDES
page.content: TOURIST{ATTITUDES}WERE SURVEYED BY ASKING ABOUT 100 VISITORS TO COMPLETE A QUESTIONAIRE. WE FOUND THAT MOST ARRIVED IN BATTLE BY CAR, BUT MANY ARRIVED BY COACH. THE AVERAGE TIME SPENT IN BATTLE WAS TWO HOURS. MOST VISITORS CAME FROM THE SOUTH OF ENGLAND, BUT MANY CAME FROM OTHER PARTS OF BRITAIN AND SOME FROM WESTERN EUROPE AND AMERICA. MOST FOREIGN VISITORS WERE TOURING ALL OF SOUTHERN ENGLAND. MOST THOUGHT THE VILLAGE INTERESTING AND THE ENTRNCE CHARGES AT THE ABBEY FAIR, ALTHOUGH THEY WOULD HAVE LIKED CLEARER SIGNS TO GIVE INFORMATION ABOUT THE BATTLEFIELD. MOST INTENDED TO BUY SMALL SOUVENEIRS SUCH AS POSTCARDS AND WERE GOING TO HAVE TEA BEFORE THEY LEFT.
